repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Bahia State Integrated Project:
            Rural Poverty

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Bahia State Integrated
            Project: Rural Poverty for Brazil were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory, the risk to development
            outcome was moderate, the Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory, and the Borrower performance was also
            moderately satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            natural resources management at the community and municipal
            level in northeast rural projects needs to move beyond the
            traditional focus on Safeguards compliance. Much can be done
            at the community level utilizing the models and lessons
            learned globally, adapted to the soil and climatic
            conditions of the Northeast. Basic principles including
            simple, climate-smart technologies should be introduced,
            coupled with awareness-building and incentives to convince
            poor producers of the longer-term payoff of adoption.
            Monitoring and evaluation require intensive focus from the
            project preparation stage to closing and beyond. Teams need
            to assess both the external environment of the project
            including political and institutional shifts, although in
            this case these could not have been known in 2005, and
            changing needs of the client and the poor. The market
            linkage aspiration was not consistent with the existing
            implementation arrangements, nor was the resource leveraging
            concept consistent with the real capacity and influence of
            the Municipal Councils, or MCs at appraisal, implying in
            this case that a follow-on operation may not have been the
            most appropriate path.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Bahia Sustainable Rural
            Development Project : indigenous peoples plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Bahia Sustainable
            Rural Development Project is to increase market integration,
            net revenues, and food security of organized beneficiaries;
            as well as to improve access to water supply and sanitation
            services of households in Project areas. In Bahia, poverty
            and inequality remain as main development challenges,
            especially in its rural areas, and especially in the
            semiarid. The project interventions comprise mainly
            small-scale investments that may cause positive or neutral
            impacts. However, a few may produce direct negative impacts
            to the surrounding environment. The implementation of
            productive arrangements heavily relies on the management
            capacity of individuals or producers organizations, which
            varies widely. Finally, traditional patterns of the social
            division of labor may hamper women's and black people
            participation in productive economy and restrict their
            access to market-related job opportunities.

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Bahia Sustainable Rural
            Development Project : resettlement plan

abstracts.cdata!:
The Bahia Sustainable Rural Development
            Project of Brazil will strengthen the commitment, strategy
            and actions of the Government to move forward in eradicating
            extreme poverty, promoting actions and investments for the
            provision of water infrastructure and income generation in
            rural areas. The project adheres to principles and adopt the
            necessary measures to ensure that the social and economic
            risks potentially associated with processes of involuntary
            resettlement are avoided, minimized or mitigated in its
            community investment. For these principles when land
            acquisition is necessary for the achievement of their
            community investments, the project will favor donation
            process of voluntary goods and ensure that it is effectively
            given without coercion. When this alternative is not viable,
            the project will adopt the necessary measures seeking
            restoration of the families' quality of life.

display_title.display_title:
Brazil - Bahia Sustainable Rural
            Development Project : resettlement plan : Marco de
            reassentamento involuntário

repnme.cdata!:
Brazil - Bahia Sustainable Rural
            Development Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The Bahia sustainable rural development
            project of Brazil has as its main aim to promote the
            socioeconomic development of the state, particularly the
            rural environment with a focus on family farming,
            agro-ecology, food and water security, and their required
            complements: socio-productive infrastructure and market
            access. It is expected that with the actions to be
            implemented by the Sustainable Rural Development Project,
            the State of Bahia can more rapidly improve the quality of
            life of the poorest municipalities and, consequently the
            state. The proposed project interventions will be
            small-scale, demand-driven investments (i.e., subprojects).
            These subprojects will not cause significant adverse
            environmental impacts, related mainly to infrastructure
            development (i.e., water, sanitation and rural roads), new
            agricultural practices (i.e., product diversification,
            conservation agriculture, promotion of value added products,
            and product certification). The project will also provide
            guidance on: (i) identifying the potential social,
            environmental and distributive impacts associated with the
            typology of project investments; (ii) minimizing potential
            impacts for productive and infrastructure subprojects; (iii)
            specifying procedures to be used in assessing environmental
            and social impacts during the subproject design stage; and
            (iv) addressing identified impacts during subproject implementation.

Brazil - Bahia Sustainable Rural
            Development Project : environmental assessment : Marco de
            gestão socioambiental
